intro: Cynanchum mongolicum var. hupehense, commonly known as the Hupeh milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
